title: Solomon's Wisdom
shortSummary: This chapter highlights Solomon's early reign, focusing on his marriage alliance, his heartfelt prayer for wisdom, and a famous demonstration of his God-given discernment in judgment. It reveals the blessings that come from seeking God's guidance and the importance of wise leadership for God's people.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Early reign of Solomon in the united Kingdom of Israel

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel, son of David, who seeks divine wisdom to govern God's people and demonstrates God-given wisdom in judgment.

keyCharacters.name: Pharaoh's Daughter
keyCharacters.description: The Egyptian princess married to Solomon as part of a political alliance, brought to Jerusalem during Solomon's building projects.

keyCharacters.name: Two Women
keyCharacters.description: Harlots who come to Solomon with a dispute over a living child, providing the occasion for Solomon's wise judgment.

definitions.definition: A familial or political alliance, often through marriage, used here to describe Solomon's marriage to Pharaoh's daughter.
Elevated sites used for worship and sacrifices, often associated with idolatry but here indicating the absence of a temple.
A biblical term referring to the ability to discern, judge, and govern wisely, especially in matters of justice.
A sacrificial offering completely consumed by fire, symbolizing atonement and dedication to God.

outline.heading: Solomon's Marriage and Worship Practices
outline.description: Solomon forms a political alliance by marrying Pharaoh's daughter and continues the practice of sacrifices at high places due to the temple's incomplete status.

outline.heading: God's Appearance to Solomon and His Prayer for Wisdom
outline.description: God appears to Solomon in a dream, inviting him to ask for anything; Solomon humbly requests wisdom to govern Israel, pleasing God who grants him unparalleled wisdom along with riches and honor.

outline.heading: The Wise Judgment of Solomon
outline.description: Two women bring a dispute over a living child to Solomon, who proposes to divide the child; the true mother’s compassion reveals her identity, showcasing Solomon’s God-given wisdom and establishing his reputation.

application: Seek God’s wisdom earnestly in prayer, prioritizing understanding and discernment over personal gain.
Trust that God honors humility and obedience, rewarding those who walk in His statutes as Solomon did.
Apply godly wisdom in decision-making, especially in matters of justice and leadership.
Recognize the importance of relying on God’s guidance rather than human strength or knowledge alone.

keyVerses.text: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures Solomon’s humble request for wisdom to govern God’s people rightly, setting the tone for his reign.

keyVerses.text: Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.
keyVerses.significance: God’s promise confirming Solomon’s unique wisdom highlights the divine source of true understanding.

keyVerses.text: Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.
keyVerses.significance: Solomon’s wise judgment reveals his God-given discernment and establishes his authority as a just ruler.

keyVerses.text: And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do judgment.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the impact of Solomon’s wisdom on the nation, inspiring respect and fear of the king as God’s chosen leader.
